name: The Block
title: Blackrocks Spot Bitcoin Etf Sees Largest Daily Outflows Since Launch
text:
Synopsis
BlackRock's Bitcoin ETF experienced significant outflows, potentially signaling institutional portfolio rebalancing amid market volatility, while key crypto industry developments continue to unfold.

Key Insights
- BlackRock's IBIT spot Bitcoin ETF saw $332.6 million in net outflows, its largest daily outflow since launch
- Despite outflows, IBIT remains the largest spot Bitcoin ETF with $37 billion in total net inflows and $53 billion in assets under management
- Do Kwon, Terraform Labs co-founder, pleaded not guilty to criminal charges including fraud and money laundering, facing up to 130 years in prison if convicted
- Stuart Hoegner retired as General Counsel for Tether and Bitfinex, with Michael Hilliard taking over legal operations
- The leadership change at Tether/Bitfinex coincides with the EU's MiCA regulation taking full effect, imposing stricter rules on stablecoin issuers
- Upcoming economic events include Eurozone CPI inflation figures, U.S. FOMC meeting minutes, and U.S. nonfarm payroll data
